title: Investigate bd daemon sharing between sandbox and host
description:
Running bd with --sandbox flag in the container causes issues with the host's bd daemon. Host bd commands start timing out and falling back to direct mode. Need to investigate:

- If daemon socket conflicts are causing the issue
- Best practices for bd in containerized environments
- Whether the sandbox should have its own isolated .beads or mount the host's

Steps:

2. Test on macOS 26+

Depends on having a working linux builder (wx-c0h or alternative).

title: NixOS VM test type check failure
description:
The NixOS integration tests fail type checking:

```
testScriptWithTypes:84: error: Incompatible types in assignment (expression has
type "tuple[int, str]", variable has type "str")  [assignment]
    result = machine.execute(
             ^
```

The `machine.execute()` returns a tuple (exit_code, output) but the test assigns it to a string variable.

This blocks `nix flake check` from passing.

title: Build NixOS podman machine image using darwin.linux-builder
description:
## Goal
Create a NixOS-based podman machine to replace the default Fedora CoreOS machine for native Nix linux-builder support.

## Background
- Podman machine on macOS uses Apple Hypervisor (vfkit), not QEMU
- Default podman machine runs Fedora CoreOS
- We need a NixOS image compatible with vfkit for native Nix builds

## Prerequisites
- darwin.linux-builder from nixpkgs (QEMU-based, pre-built from cache)
- Path: /nix/store/smc5avq1kxn465iz27ihs4g2da7lkbhd-create-builder

## Plan

### Phase 1: Bootstrap with darwin.linux-builder
1. Start the darwin.linux-builder (QEMU VM on port 31022)
2. Configure as Nix remote builder in /etc/nix/machines
3. Verify aarch64-linux builds work

### Phase 2: Build NixOS podman-compatible image
4. Create NixOS configuration for vfkit/Apple Hypervisor:
   - Use raw-efi disk format
   - Uncompressed aarch64 kernel (required for Apple VF)
   - virtio drivers for block, net, console
   - virtiofs support for host mounts (/Users, /private, /var/folders)
   - SSH server for remote access
   - Nix daemon pre-configured

5. Build the image using darwin.linux-builder:
   ```bash
   nix build --system aarch64-linux .#nixos-podman-image
   ```

### Phase 3: Create podman machine with NixOS
6. Stop existing podman machine: `podman machine stop`
7. Remove old machine: `podman machine rm podman-machine-default`
8. Create new machine with NixOS image:
   ```bash
   podman machine init --image-path /path/to/nixos.raw nixos-builder
   ```
9. Start and configure: `podman machine start nixos-builder`

### Phase 4: Configure as Nix remote builder
10. Configure SSH access to podman machine
11. Add to /etc/nix/machines with appropriate settings
12. Test linux builds work via podman machine

## NixOS Configuration Template

```nix
{ config, lib, pkgs, modulesPath, ... }:
{
  imports = [ (modulesPath + "/profiles/qemu-guest.nix") ];

  # Boot configuration for Apple Hypervisor
  boot = {
    loader.grub.efiSupport = true;
    loader.grub.efiInstallAsRemovable = true;
    loader.grub.device = "nodev";
    initrd.kernelModules = [ "virtio_pci" "virtio_blk" ];
    # Uncompressed kernel for Apple VF
    kernelParams = [ "console=ttyAMA0,115200n8" ];
  };

  # Filesystem layout
  fileSystems."/" = { device = "/dev/vda2"; fsType = "ext4"; };
  fileSystems."/boot" = { device = "/dev/vda1"; fsType = "vfat"; };

  # Networking
  networking.hostName = "nixos-builder";
  networking.useDHCP = true;

  # SSH for remote builder access
  services.openssh.enable = true;
  services.openssh.settings.PermitRootLogin = "yes";

  # Nix daemon configuration
  nix.settings.trusted-users = [ "root" "@wheel" ];
  nix.settings.experimental-features = [ "nix-command" "flakes" ];

  # User configuration
  users.users.root.initialPassword = "nixos";

  system.stateVersion = "24.11";
}
```

## Key Considerations
- Apple Hypervisor requires uncompressed aarch64 kernel
- virtiofs mounts may need special configuration
- podman machine expects specific partition layout
- SSH key exchange needed for remote builder auth

## References
- darwin.linux-builder: https://ryantm.github.io/nixpkgs/builders/special/darwin-builder/
- NixOS disk images: https://jade.fyi/blog/nixos-disk-images-m1/
- nixos-generators: https://github.com/nix-community/nixos-generators
close_reason: User chose nix-darwin linux-builder (nix.linux-builder.enable = true) instead of building a custom NixOS podman machine
